tool.name: Sample counts
tool.description: Tells you how many sequences are in each sample.
tool.command: convert_category_map_to_id_map.py -i $category_map_file -o mapping.txt; convert_unifrac_sample_mapping_to_otu_table.py -i $sample_id_file -o otu_table.biom; per_library_stats.py -i otu_table.biom -o per_lib_stats_output.txt -m mapping.txt #if not $weights: --otu_counts #end if ;make_sample_counts_html.py -m per_lib_stats_output.txt -o $html_output
tool.help:
The **Sample Counts** option produces a table that reports number of sequences in eachs ample, along with a description of each sample (if you provided that information in the category mapping file). An example of the sample counts table is shown below.
.. image:: ./static/images/fastunifrac/sample_counts/output_example.jpg
